intro: Tontelea hondurensis, commonly known as the Honduran tontelea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
